baseCode.1: We can add namespce which may be useful when developing class libraries
baseCode.2: :Styles inside global will generate global styles

slogan: Has near-zero runtime, SSR, theming, and a fully typed API, and it's only 3kb in size.
fastDesc: Avoid unnecessary style props at runtime and avoid double-computing rendering.
typescriptDesc: Flexible API and full TypeScript types.
themeDesc: Provides an easy way to customize the theme, you can change colors, fonts, breakpoints and everything you need.
smallDesc: Only 3kb overhead while providing full functionality.

withBaseDesc.1: The usage is almost the same as otherCSS In JSframeworks
withBaseDesc.2: Supports special nested selectors`&`andCSSall native selectors, and also provides a polymorphic`as`property, used to define the label that the component renders
withBaseDesc.3: Also, if usingTypescript, prop definitions are updated when`as`props are added

withVariantsDesc.1: Style components are created with a`variants`attribute
withVariantsDesc.2: You can define a single dynamic rule, multiple dynamic rules, or even compound dynamic rules
withVariantsDesc.3: Dynamic interpolation replaces props props passing, because passing values through props will bring a large performance overhead, in addition, we may write the following code.

withThemeDesc: Styilprovides a completely free theme experience. Apply them wherever you want as needed.

withSSRDesc.1: Styilprovides a completely free theme experience. Apply them wherever you want as needed.
withSSRDesc.2: If using themegetCssValueshould be exported fromcreateSystem

withKeyframesDesc: Styilprovides two ways to define as you like.
withGlobalDesc: Styilprovides two ways to define as you like.
withMediaDesc: Just like using media queries in regularCSS,@mediacan be placed directly in theCSSblock.
change-a-variant: Change the variant of the component
change-css-prop: Change the value in the prop

testResults.desc1: The last run should be about the same or faster than the first
testResults.desc2: Standard deviation should be only a few milliseconds
